citation.article-title: Cellulolytic and dextranolytic Gram-negative bacteria: revival of the genus Cellvibrio.

p.s: Description of Cellvibrio mixtus sp. nov.
Cellvibrio mixtus (mix.tus, M.L. masc. adj. mixtus mixed, referring to the type of flagellation)

Description: Growth on PYEA is poor or non-existent but on SPA colonies have either of the following descriptions: white to cream, convex to low convex, translucent, mucoid and circular with an entire edge, smooth surface and diameter of 1-3 mm or orange-yellow, flat, translucent, circular, irregular edge, dull surface and diameter of 1-3 mm.
All strains on defined mineral salts medium with added cellulose are white, circular, with an entire edge, smooth consistency and surrounded by a small zone of clearing in the semi-opaque medium.
Motile cells exhibit mixed flagellation, with a single polar flagellum and up to 11 lateral flagella of a different thickness and wavelength.

Acid is produced from L-arabinose, dextrin, galactose, glucose, lactose, maltose, mannose, melibiose, raffinose, sucrose, trehalose and xylose but not adonitol, arabitol, D-arabinose, dulcitol, erythritol, glycerol, inositol, mannitol, ribose, sorbitol or sorbose.
Starch, chitin, neutral pH and alkaline pH pectate gels and aesculin are hydrolysed.
The enzymes α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase and β-xylosidase are produced but not urease, α-fucosidase, arginine dihydrolase, arylsulphatase, acylamidase or phenylalanine deaminase.
Gelatin, casein, DNA, Tween 80 and acid pH pectate gel cannot be hydrolysed.
All strains produce curdlan polysaccharide from glucose and grow on GYEA, PYEA plus 5% sucrose and glucose ammonium sulphate agar.
Growth does not occur on cetrimide agar, in an anaerobic environment, at 42°C, on glucose nitrogen free medium, in alkylamine mineral salts medium or in phenol mineral salts medium.

Further tests found to be negative are: utilization of organic acids as sole sources of carbon, acid from ethanol, 3-ketolactose from lactose, dihydroxyacetone from glycerol, oxidation of gluconate, indole production from tryptophan, gas from nitrate, H2S from cystine, methyl red test, Voges-Proskauer reaction and tolerance of 0.0075% KCN.
Two subspecies are proposed, and these may be differentiated by the characteristics described below.
